'''STATEROOM''' is the [[code name]] of a highly secretive [[signals intelligence]] collection program involving the interception of international radio, telecommunications and internet traffic. It is operated out of the [[diplomatic mission]]s of the signatories to the [[UKUSA Agreement]] and the members of the [[ECHELON]] network including Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, Canada and the United States.<ref name=nytimesau>{{cite web | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/01/world/asia/australia-participated-in-nsa-program-document-says.html | title=Australia Said to Play Part in N.S.A. Effort | author=Jane Perlez | work=The New York Times | date=2013-10-31 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH1mrBrZ?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/01/world/asia/australia-participated-in-nsa-program-document-says.html?_r=0 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="spiegelstate">{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/fotostrecke/photo-gallery-spies-in-the-embassy-fotostrecke-103079-5.html | title=Photo Gallery: Spies in the Embassy | author=Spiegel Online | work=Spiegel Online | date=2013-10-28 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH2Ie49N?url=http://www.spiegel.de/fotostrecke/photo-gallery-spies-in-the-embassy-fotostrecke-103079-5.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
In almost a hundred U.S. embassies and consulates worldwide, Stateroom operations are conducted by the [[Special Collection Service]] (SCS), a unit that is jointly operated by the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] (CIA) and the [[National Security Agency]] (NSA).<ref name="Laura Poitras, Marcel Rosenbach and Holger Stark">{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/secret-nsa-documents-show-how-the-us-spies-on-europe-and-the-un-a-918625.html | title=Secret NSA Documents Show How the US Spies on Europe and the UN | author1=Laura Poitras | author2=Marcel Rosenbach | author3=Holger Stark | work=Der Spiegel | date=2013-08-26 | accessdate=2013-08-30 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JG7c80iJ?url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/secret-nsa-documents-show-how-the-us-spies-on-europe-and-the-un-a-918625.html | archivedate=30 August 2013 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}, Page [https://www.webcitation.org/6OH2UKUd6?url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/secret-nsa-documents-show-how-the-us-spies-on-europe-and-the-un-a-918625-2.html 2] at archive.</ref>
According to documents leaked by [[Edward Snowden]], the true mission of Stateroom personnel is generally not revealed to the rest of the diplomatic staff at the facilities where they are assigned.<ref name="spiegelstate"/>
== Members ==
[[File:SCSGlobalPresence.png|thumb|Location and status of CIA/NSA [[Special Collection Service]] (SCS) eavesdropping sites as of 13 August 2010]] *{{flagicon|Australia}} – [[Australian Signals Directorate]] (ASD), formerly known as the [[Defence Signals Directorate]] (DSD) *{{flagicon|Canada}} – [[Communications Security Establishment]] (CSE) *{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} – [[Government Communications Headquarters]] (GCHQ) *{{flagicon|United States}} – [[Special Collection Service]] (SCS) *{{flagicon|New Zealand}} – [[Government Communications Security Bureau]] (GCSB)
== Operations == '''Note: The list of locations in the following section is non-exhaustive, and only includes publicly disclosed information.
=== Australia ===
The collection of [[signals intelligence]] by Australian embassies and high commissions occurs in capital cities across [[East|East Asia]] and Southeast Asia, namely: [[Bangkok]] (Thailand), Beijing (China), [[Dili]] (East Timor), [[Hanoi]] (Vietnam), [[Jakarta]] (Indonesia), [[Kuala Lumpur]] (Malaysia), [[Port Moresby]] (Papua New Guinea)<ref name=nytimesau/><ref name=PhilipDorling22dec>{{cite web | url=http://www.smh.com.au/it-pro/security-it/australias-asia-spy-network-exposed-20131030-hv2ao.html | title=Australia's Asia spy network exposed | author=Philip Dorling | work=The Sydney Morning Herald | date=2013-10-31 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH30TgsR?url=http://www.smh.com.au/it-pro/security-it/australias-asia-spy-network-exposed-20131030-hv2ao.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
=== Canada ===
In the 1980s, surveys were conducted by Canada's CSE agency to pick out Canadian embassies suitable to function as surveillance posts.<ref name="o.canada-csec-spying">{{cite web | url=http://o.canada.com/news/canadian-facilities-used-for-u-s-spying-efforts-nsa-documents/ | title=Canadian embassies in U.S.-led spying efforts: Der Spiegel documents | author=Lauren Strapagiel | work=canada.com | date=2013-10-29 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4ATxoV?url=http://o.canada.com/news/canadian-facilities-used-for-u-s-spying-efforts-nsa-documents/ | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
=== New Zealand === As of 16 March 2015, New Zealand's GCSB agency had a secret listening post, codenamed "Caprica", at the New Zealand High Commission in [[Honiara]], the capital of the [[Solomon Islands]]. The "Caprica" outpost was reportedly modeled after the NSA's Stateroom outposts at selected United States Embassies across the world.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hager|first1=Nicky|last2=Gallagher|first2=Ryan|title=GCSB had Solomons post, papers show|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11417762|accessdate=16 March 2015|publisher=New Zealand Herald|date=16 March 2015}}</ref>
=== United Kingdom === [[File:RAF Croughton - geograph.org.uk - 464357.jpg|thumb|[[RAF Croughton]] in Northamptonshire, England]] As of 2013, British embassies and consulates in the following capital cities are known to contain clandestine surveillance facilities:
* [[Berlin]] (Germany)<ref name=independentstateroom>{{cite web | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/revealed-britains-secret-listening-post-in-the-heart-of-berlin-8921548.html | title=Revealed: Britain's 'secret listening post in the heart of Berlin' | author1=Duncan Campbell | author2=Cahal Milmo | author3=Kim Sengupta | author4=Nigel Morris | author5=Tony Patterson | work=The Independent | date=2013-11-05 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH3GDi3R?url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/revealed-britains-secret-listening-post-in-the-heart-of-berlin-8921548.html | archivedate=22 March 2014 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Data collected by Britain is sent to a relay facility at [[RAF Croughton]] in Northamptonshire, England, before being transmitted to a data center jointly operated by the U.S. [[Central Intelligence Agency]] and the U.S. [[National Security Agency]] in [[College Park, Maryland]].<ref name=independentcia>{{cite web | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/exclusive-raf-croughton-base-sent-secrets-from-merkels-phone-straight-to-the-cia-8923401.html | title=Exclusive: RAF Croughton base 'sent secrets from Merkel's phone straight to the CIA' | author1=Duncan Campbell | author2=Cahal Milmo | work=The Independent | date=2013-11-05 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH3gAL0D?url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/exclusive-raf-croughton-base-sent-secrets-from-merkels-phone-straight-to-the-cia-8923401.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="campbell11"/>
=== United States === [[File:Worldwide NSA signals intelligence.jpg|thumb|On 23 November 2013, the Dutch newspaper ''[[NRC Handelsblad]]'' released a [[top secret]] NSA presentation leaked by Snowden that shows, among others, locations of the U.S. [[Special Collection Service]] (SCS).<ref name="nrc-nsa-malicious-software">{{cite web | url=http://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2013/11/23/nsa-infected-50000-computer-networks-with-malicious-software/ | title=NSA infected 50,000 computer networks with malicious software | author1=Floor Boon | author2=Steven Derix | author3=Huib Modderkolk | work=NRC Handelsblad | date=2013-11-23 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4HfuXd?url=http://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2013/11/23/nsa-infected-50000-computer-networks-with-malicious-software/ | archivedate=22 March 2014 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>]] In the United States, the U.S. [[Special Collection Service]] (SCS) contributes to Stateroom. The SCS is jointly operated by the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] (CIA) and the [[National Security Agency]] (NSA).<ref name="Laura Poitras, Marcel Rosenbach and Holger Stark"/> On 23 November 2013, the Dutch newspaper ''[[NRC Handelsblad]]'' released a [[top secret]] NSA presentation leaked by [[Edward Snowden]], which shows the presence of SCS operations in numerous U.S. [[diplomatic mission]]s located in the following cities: [[Athens]] ([[Greece]]), [[Bangkok]] ([[Thailand]]), [[Berlin]] ([[Germany]]), [[Brasília]] ([[Brazil]]), [[Budapest]] ([[Hungary]]), [[Frankfurt]] ([[Germany]]), [[Geneva]] ([[Switzerland]]), [[Lagos]] ([[Nigeria]]), [[Milan]] ([[Italy]]), [[New Delhi]] ([[India]]), [[Paris]] ([[France]]), [[Prague]] ([[Czech Republic]]), [[Vienna]] ([[Austria]]), [[Zagreb]] ([[Croatia]]).
In October 2013, reports by former NSA contractor [[Edward Snowden]] led to the revelation of the SCS having systematically wiretapped [[Chancellor of Germany]] [[Angela Merkel]]'s private cell phone over a period of over 10 years, among other activities to wiretap and systematically record large amounts of European and South American leaders' and citizens' communications.<ref name="spiegel-nsa-spionage-station-berlin">{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/cover-story-how-nsa-spied-on-merkel-cell-phone-from-berlin-embassy-a-930205.html | title=Cover Story: How NSA Spied on Merkel Cell Phone from Berlin Embassy | author=Spiegel Staff | work=Spiegel Online | date=2013-10-27 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4UG9f7?url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/cover-story-how-nsa-spied-on-merkel-cell-phone-from-berlin-embassy-a-930205.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}, pages [https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4c19Wt?url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/cover-story-how-nsa-spied-on-merkel-cell-phone-from-berlin-embassy-a-930205-2.html 2] and [https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4cdy6k?url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/cover-story-how-nsa-spied-on-merkel-cell-phone-from-berlin-embassy-a-930205-3.html 3] at archive.</ref>
Other SCS locations include [[Baku]] (Azerbaijan), [[Kiev]] (Ukraine), [[Madrid]] (Spain), [[Moscow]] (Russia), [[Pristina]] (Kosovo), Rome (Italy), [[Sarajevo]] (Bosnia), [[Tbilisi]] (Georgia), and [[Tirana]] (Albania).<ref name="campbell11">{{cite web | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/germany-calls-in-britains-ambassador-to-demand-explanation-over-secret-berlin-listening-post-8923082.html | title=Germany calls in Britain's ambassador to demand explanation over 'secret Berlin listening post' | author1=Nigel Morris | author2=Cahal Milmo | author3=Duncan Campbell | author4=Kim Sengupta | author5=Tony Paterson | work=The Independent | date=2013-11-06 | accessdate=2014-03-22 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH3w4net?url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/germany-calls-in-britains-ambassador-to-demand-explanation-over-secret-berlin-listening-post-8923082.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
== Disclosure by Edward Snowden ==
The existence of Stateroom was revealed in October 2013 by the former NSA contractor [[Edward Snowden]], who initiated the [[global surveillance disclosure]].<ref name=nzherald/>
{{quote|...These sites are small in size and in number of personnel staffing them. They are [[Covert operation|covert]], and their true mission is not known by the majority of the [[diplomat|diplomatic staff]] at the facility where they are assigned.|[[:file:NSA Stateroom 2.jpg|Excerpt from the NSA's STATEROOM Guide]]}}
== Reactions ==
Damien Rogers, former senior adviser to the New Zealand intelligence agency [[Government Communications Security Bureau]] (GCSB) said he was surprised to hear that the "Stateroom" codeword and location of associated sites are being published in the media, because such revelations would cause "anxiety and concern" for the directors of the five intelligence agencies of the [[UKUSA Agreement]].<ref name=nzherald>{{cite web | url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11149739 | title=NZ link to Oz spying claims | author=Adam Bennett | work=The New Zealand Herald | date=2013-11-01 | accessdate=2014-03-23 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH4okzSC?url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11149739 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref> [[Nicky Hager]], a New Zealand investigative journalist who exposed the '''[[ECHELON]]''' surveillance system, confirmed that such surveillance operations have been conducted by the intelligence agencies of the [[UKUSA Agreement|Five Eyes]] for quite some time.<ref name=nzherald/>
=== Australia === A spokesman for Australia's [[Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (Australia)|Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade]] said: "It is the long-standing practice of Australian governments not to comment on intelligence matters."<ref name=PhilipDorling22dec/> Australian Prime Minister [[Tony Abbott]] told reporters that "Every Australian governmental agency, every Australian official at home and abroad operates in accordance with the law, and that's the assurance that I can give people at home and abroad".<ref name=wannsa>{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/outrage-at-alleged-us-spying-efforts-gathers-steam-in-asian-capitals/2013/10/31/59ad7f22-4217-11e3-a624-41d661b0bb78_story.html | title=Outrage at alleged U.S. spying efforts gathers steam in Asian capitals | author=William Wan | work=The Washington Post | date=2013-10-31 | accessdate=2014-03-23 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH504pET?url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/outrage-at-alleged-us-spying-efforts-gathers-steam-in-asian-capitals/2013/10/31/59ad7f22-4217-11e3-a624-41d661b0bb78_story.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
=== Canada === Government representatives at CSE declined to comment directly on the leak. A spokeswoman for Canada's Defence Minister [[Rob Nicholson]] declined to comment.<ref name="theglobeandmail-can-spioniert">{{cite web | url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/canada-involved-in-us-spying-efforts-abroad-leaked-document-says/article15133508/ | title=Canadian embassies eavesdrop, leak says | author=Colin Freeze | work=The Globe and Mail | language=| date=2013-10-31 | accessdate=2014-03-23}}</ref>
=== China === Hua Chunying, a spokeswoman for China's [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China|Foreign Ministry]], reacted angrily and demanded that foreign entities and personnel in China "strictly abide" by the [[Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations]], the [[Vienna Convention on Consular Relations]] and other international treaties.<ref name=nytimesau/>
=== Germany === [[File:View from Reichstag to Brandenburg Gate and US Embassy.JPG|thumb|right|A view from the rooftop terrace of the [[Reichstag building]] in Berlin, the seat of the German parliament. In the background, behind the [[Brandenburg Gate]], the [[Embassy of the United States, Berlin|United States Embassy]] can be seen. The grey structure on the embassy's roof (top right corner of the photograph) is thought to contain surveillance equipment, possibly used to tap into mobile phones.<ref name="spiegel-nsa-berlin-abhöranlagen-funktionieren">{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/netzwelt/netzpolitik/nsa-spaehskandal-so-funktionieren-die-abhoeranlagen-in-us-botschaften-a-930392.html | title=NSA-Spähskandal: So funktionieren die Abhöranlagen in US-Botschaften | author1=Konrad Lischka | author2=Matthias Kremp | work=Spiegel Online | date=2013-10-28 | accessdate=2014-03-23 | language=German | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH5XNXMw?url=http://www.spiegel.de/netzwelt/netzpolitik/nsa-spaehskandal-so-funktionieren-die-abhoeranlagen-in-us-botschaften-a-930392.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>]]
German Foreign Minister [[Guido Westerwelle]] summoned [[List of diplomats of the United Kingdom to Germany|Britain's Ambassador to Germany]], Simon McDonald, to explain and to clarify the presence of Britain's eavesdropping centre in [[Berlin]].<ref name="bbc-ger-gbr-botschafter">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-24824633 | title=Germany calls in British ambassador over spy claims | author=British Broadcasting Corporation | work=British Broadcasting Corporation | date=2013-11-05 | accessdate=2014-03-23 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH5prmKD?url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-24824633 | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="telegraph-ger-gbr-botschafter">{{cite web | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/10428050/Germany-calls-in-British-ambassador-over-Berlin-spying-claim.html | title=Germany calls in British ambassador over Berlin spying claim | author=David Blair | work=The Telegraph | date=2013-11-05 | accessdate=2014-03-23 | archivedate=22 March 2014 | archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OH60aa7T?url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/10428050/Germany-calls-in-British-ambassador-over-Berlin-spying-claim.html | deadurl=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
=== Indonesia === Indonesian Foreign Minister [[Marty Natalegawa]] protested against the surveillance program, and told the media that "such action is not only a breach of security, but also a serious violation of diplomatic norms and ethics, and certainly not in tune with the spirit of friendly relations between nations."<ref name=wannsa/>
=== Malaysia === Malaysia's Minister of Home Affairs, [[Ahmad Zahid Hamidi]], said that Snowden's revelation is a "sensitive issue since it involves several countries".<ref name=wannsa/>
=== Solomon Islands === The Solomon Islands' Chief of Staff, [[Robert Iroga]], said that the New Zealand Government's actions damaged New Zealand's image as a "friendly government" in the South Pacific. He added that communications within the inner circle of the Solomons Government was "highly secret information" that rightfully belong to the Solomon Islanders.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fisher|first1=David|title=GCSB spied on inner circle of former Solomon Islands PM and anti-corruption campaigner|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11417445|accessdate=15 March 2015|publisher=[[New Zealand Herald]]|date=15 March 2015}}</ref> In addition, Iroga accused New Zealand officials of bullying-behavior in trade negotiations and alleged that New Zealand had shared information regarding [[Taiwan]]ese aid money with China.<ref>{{cite news|title=New Zealand response to Solomons spying documents 'hypocritical'|url=http://www.radionz.co.nz/international/programmes/datelinepacific/audio/20171817/new-zealand-response-to-solomons-spying-documents-%27hypocritical%27|accessdate=23 March 2015|publisher=Radio New Zealand|date=23 March 2015}}</ref>
=== Thailand === Thailand's [[Council for National Security|National Security Council]] asserted that such forms of surveillance are considered to be acts of criminality under the [[Law of Thailand]].<ref>{{cite news |first= Kristen |last= Gelineau |title= Indonesia Summons Aussie Ambassador over Spy Claim |url= http://bigstory.ap.org/article/china-other-asian-angry-over-embassy-spy-reports |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/6MwR7Udpp?url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/china-other-asian-angry-over-embassy-spy-reports |archivedate= 27 January 2014 |agency= [[Associated Press]] |accessdate= 23 December 2013 |deadurl= yes |df= dmy-all }}</ref>

{{Infobox organization | name = United Jewish People's Order | native_name = | native_name_lang = | abbreviation = | formation = {{start date and age|1926|04}} | founder = | founding_location = | merger = | type = | status = Active | headquarters = 585 Cranbrooke Avenue
[[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] | leader_title = Executive Director | leader_name = Rachel Epstein | affiliations = [[Canadian Peace Alliance|CPA]], CSJO, IFSHJ, [[International Institute for Secular Humanistic Judaism|IISHJ]] | volunteers = | volunteers_year = | languages = [[Yiddish language|Yiddish]], [[English language|English]] | website = {{URL|ujpo.org}} | formerly = Jewish Labour League Mutual Benefit Society }} The '''United Jewish People's Order''' is a [[Jewish secularism|secular]] [[Political radicalism|radical]] [[Socialism|socialist]] [[Judaism|Jewish]] cultural, political and educational [[fraternal organization]] in [[Canada]]. The UJPO traces its history to the founding of the Jewish Labour League Mutual Benefit Society in 1926. ==History== ===Early history=== After the [[Russian Revolution]] and the creation of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union|Communist Party]], divisions within the [[Workmen's Circle|Arbeiter Ring]] became increasingly bitter. In Toronto, the pro-[[Bolsheviks|Bolshevik]] women withdrew from the Ring in 1923, forming the Jewish Working Women's League (''Yiddish Arbeiter Froyen Farein'').{{cite journal|title=Secular ''Yiddishkait'': Left Politics, Culture, and Community|first=Ester|last=Reiter|journal=[[Labour/Le Travail]]|volume=49|date=Spring 2002|pages=121-146|publisher=Canadian Committee on Labour History|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/25149216|jstor= 25149216}} When it was clear that control of the organization would stay in the hands of those critical of the Revolution, the men also withdrew and formed the Jewish Labour League Mutual Benefit Society in 1926, which became social and intellectual home for Jewish [[Communism|Communists]]{{cite journal|title="The Dresden Story": Racism, Human Rights, and the Jewish Labour Committee of Canada|first=Ross|last=Lambertson|page=48|journal=[[Labour/Le Travail]]|volume=47|date=Spring 2001|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/25149113|jstor=25149113|publisher=Canadian Committee on Labour History}} The Canadian Workers' Circle was similarly formed in [[Montreal]] and [[Winnipeg]]. The two organizations merged on 4 October 1945 to form the UJPO.{{cite book|chapter=Secular Organizations|title=Not Written in Stone: Jews, Constitutions, and Constitutionalism in Canada|editor1-first=Daniel J.|editor1-last=Elazar|editor2-first=Michael|editor2-last=Brown|editor3-first=Ira|editor3-last=Robinson|publisher=University of Ottawa Press|date=2003|chapter-url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1ckpg27.18}}. At its peak in the 1940s and 1950s, the UJPO had more than 2,500 members nationwide with branches being established in [[Hamilton, Ontario|Hamilton]] and [[Niagara Falls, Ontario|Niagara Falls]], [[Calgary]], and [[Vancouver]], among others. The UJPO's leadership included well-known Jewish Communists and pro-Soviet activists, including [[Sholem Shtern]], [[J. B. Salsberg]], [[Joseph Zuken]], [[Sam Carr]], and [[Fred Rose (politician)|Fred Rose]].{{cite book|title=Jerusalem on the Amur: Birobidzhan and the Canadian Jewish Communist Movement, 1924-1951|first=Henry Felix|last=Srebrnik|publisher=McGill-Queen's University Press||year=2008|url=https://www.worldcat.org/title/jerusalem-on-the-amur-birobidzhan-and-the-canadian-jewish-communist-movement-1924-1951/oclc/632050111|oclc=632050111}} The CJPO was active in supporting Jewish settlement in [[Birobidzhan]] through the [[Organization for Jewish Colonization in Russia|Canadian Biro-Bidjan Committee]].{{r|srebrnik}} ===Cold War era=== The Toronto branch of the UJPO was originally housed in the Jewish Workers' Cultural Centre on Brunswick Avenue, just north of [[Kensington Market]], then for many years in its own building on Christie Street, overlooking [[Christie Pits]].{{cite book|title=Joe Salsberg: A Life of Commitment|first=Gerald|last=Tulchinsky|location=Toronto|publisher=University of Toronto Press|year=2013|isbn=978-1-4426-1432-1|url=https://books.google.ca/books?redir_esc=y&id=HYqBAAAAQBAJ}} UJPO's headquarters in [[Montreal]] were in the Morris Winchevsky Cultural Centre on de l'Esplanade Avenue from 1947. UJPO Montreal also operated the Morris Winchevsky Yiddish School on Villeneuve Street West and operated [[summer camps]] such as the Nitgedeiget. The UJPO headquarters included, as a unique feature, a second story [[balcony]] with a five-foot-tall [[parapet]] modelled on balconies in Moscow's [[Red Square (Moscow)|Red Square]] from which Soviet leaders would address the crowd below. On January 27, 1950, the group's Montreal headquarters were closed under the [[Padlock Law]], with boxes of seized books, files and organizational material carted away by the [[Quebec Provincial Police]]. Following the raid, the building was sold to the [[Farband]], a [[Labour Zionist]] organization, which used the building from 1951 until 1968, with the first floor being occupied by Glatt's, a [[Kosher meat|kosher butcher]] from 1962 until the 2010s.{{cite news|title=Collapsed Mile End building once targeted by anti-communist Padlock Law|first=Stephen|last=Smith|date=19 February 2017|location=Montreal|newspaper=[[CBC News]]|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/collapsed-mile-end-building-once-targeted-by-anti-communist-padlock-law-1.3990671}}{{cite web|first=Zev|last=Moses|website=Third Solitude Series|publisher=[[Museum of Jewish Montreal]]|date=20 April 2012|url=http://thirdsolitude.tumblr.com/post/21450294508/notjustanotherbalcony|title=A balcony under threat in Balconville}} In 1951, the UJPO was expelled from the [[Canadian Jewish Congress]], not to be re-admitted until 1995.{{cite conference |first=Ester|last1=Reiter|first2=Roz|last2=Usiskin|url=http://www.vcn.bc.ca/outlook/library/articles/jewsontheleft/p05Forum1.htm|title=Jewish Dissent in Canada: The United Jewish People's Order|conference=Forum on Jewish Dissent|publisher=Association of Canadian Jewish Studies|location=Winnipeg|date=30 May 2004}} After 1955, Sam Carr became active in the UJPO and was elected National Secretary in 1964, a position he would hold until 1986.{{cite journal|page=82|title=Ignacy Witczak's Passport, Soviet Espionage and the Origins of the Cold War in Canada|first=Myron|last=Momryk|journal=Polish American Studies|volume=68|number=2|date=Autumn 2011|publisher=University of Illinois Press|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/23075179|jstor= 23075179}} During the crisis resulting from the release of the [[On the Cult of Personality and Its Consequences|Secret Speech]] in 1956, prominent Party member J. B. Salsberg returned from a trip to the [[Soviet Union]], where he found rampant [[Antisemitism in the Soviet Union|Party-sponsored antisemitism]] and suppression of [[Jewish culture]]. Salsberg's findings were rejected by the [[Communist Party of Canada|Communist Party]] (then known as the [[Labor-Progressive Party|Labour-Progressive Party]]) and led to his suspension from its leading bodies. Ultimately, the crisis resulted in the departure of the UJPO, Salsberg, [[Robert Laxer]] and most of the Party's Jewish members in 1956. In 1959 about one third of the UJPO's membership (including long-time leader J. B. Salsberg) left to start a new organization called the [[New Fraternal Jewish Association]], feeling that the UJPO was not critical enough of the Soviet Union.{{cite journal|title=Portrait of a Jewish Professional Revolutionary: The Recollections of Joshua Gershman|first=Irving|last=Abella|author-link=Irving Abella|journal=[[Labour/Le Travail]]|volume=2|year=1977|pages=184-213|publisher=Canadian Committee on Labour History|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/25139902|jstor= 25139902}} In the years following [[World War II]], as the Jewish community moved north along [[Bathurst Street, Toronto|Bathurst Street]], the UJPO moved in 1960 to its current location at the Winchevsky Centre in the Bathurst and [[Lawrence Avenue|Lawrence]] area.{{cite web|title=Our History: 80 Years Strong|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120205193145/http://www.winchevskycentre.org/welcome/history.html|archive-date=5 February 2012|url=http://www.winchevskycentre.org/welcome/history.html|website=The Winchevsky Centre|access-date=21 November 2018}} ===Recent history=== In 2011, the [[United Jewish Appeal]] and Canadian Jewish Congress severed their relations with UJPO's Winchevsky Centre in Toronto after the organization hosted a panel discussion featuring [[Anti-Zionism|anti-Zionist]] activist and Auschwitz survivor [[Hajo Meyer]], a member of the [[International Jewish Anti-Zionist Network]].{{cite news|url=http://www.cjnews.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=20810&Itemid=86|title=UJA, CJC sever ties with Winchevsky Centre|newspaper=[[The Canadian Jewish News]]|date=10 February 2011}} ==Activities== The UJPO has branches in [[Winnipeg]], [[Montreal]], [[Vancouver]], and [[Toronto]] where it operates the Winchevsky Centre, named after the famed Jewish socialist poet [[Morris Winchevsky]]. The Toronto branch sponsors several groups including the [[Morris Winchevsky School]] which holds classes at the Bathurst Street Community Centre, the [[Toronto Jewish Folk Choir]], and [[Camp Naivelt]], a socialist Jewish [[Summer camp|camp]] in [[Brampton, Ontario]]. The Vancouver branch published a national progressive Jewish magazine ''[[Outlook (Jewish magazine)|Outlook]]'', and runs a number of cultural and educational activities.{{cite web|archive-date=3 March 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303165436/http://www.winchevskycentre.org/institutions/A_PBrochure.pdf|url=http://www.winchevskycentre.org/institutions/A_PBrochure.pdf|title=Who We Are|publisher=United Jewish People's Order|year=2004}}{{cite journal|first=Gerald|last=Tulchinsky|url=http://www.historycooperative.org/journals/llt/56/tulchinsky.html|title=Family Quarrel: Joe Salsberg, the 'Jewish' Question, and Canadian Communism|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120214093619/http://www.historycooperative.org/journals/llt/56/tulchinsky.html|archive-date=14 February 2012|journal=[[Labour/Le Travail]]|volume=56|date=Fall 2005}} The Jewish Folk Choir held well attended concerts, several of which included [[Paul Robeson]], featuring Yiddish and [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]] music. Another contribution to music made, indirectly, by the UJPO was the founding of the folk group [[The Travellers (band)|The Travellers]], which originated at [[Camp Naivelt]] in the 1950s.{{cite news|title=Archives house valuable artifacts of Canada’s Jewish left|first=Bill|last=Gladstone|date=14 October 2016|newspaper=[[The Canadian Jewish News]]|url=https://www.cjnews.com/news/canada/valuable-artifacts-canadas-jewish-left}} [[Zal Yanofsky]] spent his childhood years at Camp Naivelt and would later go on to found [[the Loving Spoonful]] with [[John Sebastian]] in 1964. ==See also== * [[Camp Naivelt]] — UJPO affiliated family camp * [[Morris Winchevsky School]] — a secular Jewish school affiliated with UJPO which offers weekend classes for children *''[[Vochenblatt]]'' — Yiddish weekly associated with UJPO * [[Organization for Jewish Colonization in Russia]] * [[Jewish People's Fraternal Order]] (U.S. equivalent of UJPO) * [[Federation of Russian Canadians]] * [[Canadian Jewish Congress]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ujpo.org United Jewish People's Order website] *[http://www.winchevskycentre.org The Winchevsky Centre, Toronto] [[Category:Communist parties in Canada]] [[Category:Communist Party of Canada mass organizations]] [[Category:Jewish community organizations]] [[Category:Jewish political organizations]] [[Category:Jewish clubs and societies]] [[Category:Secular Jewish culture in Canada]] [[Category:Non-profit organizations based in Canada]] [[Category:Socialist parties in Canada]] [[Category:Labour history of Canada]] [[Category:Jewish Canadian history]] [[Category:Jewish organizations based in Canada]] [[Category:Jewish socialism]]

'''Veneto Yes''' ({{lang-it|Veneto Sì}}) is a [[Venetian nationalism|Venetist]]-[[separatism|separatist]] [[list of political parties in Veneto|political party in Veneto]]. Its leader is [[Gianluca Busato]].
The party supports the secession of [[Veneto]] from [[Italy]] and is the heir of ''[[Plebiscito.eu]]'', the committee which organised the [[Venetian independence referendum, 2014|2014 Venetian independence referendum]]. The day after the referendum, Busato announced that the separatist process generated by the referendum was to be led by Veneto Yes, which would be transformed "from committee for yes to independence to a political organisation which will defend the results obtained with the declaration of independence".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.venetosi.org/a-tutto-campo/ |title=A TUTTO CAMPO | Veneto Sì, a difesa dell'indipendenza della Repubblica Veneta |publisher=Venetosi.org |date=2014-03-22 |accessdate=2015-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilgazzettino.it/NORDEST/PRIMOPIANO/veneto_s_amp_igrave_partito_referendum_veneto_beppe_grillo_indipendenza/notizie/589333.shtml |title=Dopo il referendum, nasce il partito |publisher=Ilgazzettino.it |date= |accessdate=2015-02-27}}</ref>
The party participated in the March 2015 unofficial Venetian general election (organised by ''Plebiscito.eu''), during which it elected a large majority of the deputies,<ref>http://blog.plebiscito.eu/parlamento-veneto-i-risultati-delle-elezioni-2015/</ref> but did not manage to take part to the May 2015 official [[Venetian regional election, 2015|regional election]], due to its inability to file the required number of signatures for its lists.<ref>http://www.ilgazzettino.it/speciale_elezioni/regionali_2015/plebiscito_milioni_firme_elezioni_regionali-1014528.html</ref>
==Leadership== *Secretary: [[Gianluca Busato]] (2013–present)

{{Multiple issues| {{Copy edit|for=capitalization|date=October 2018}} {{External links|date=October 2018}} {{Lead too long|date=October 2018}}}} {{Infobox person | name = Yonnette Fleming | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = | residence = | nationality = | education = | occupation = Urban Food Justice Farmer | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | website = {{url|http://www.hattiecarthangarden.com/}} | footnotes = }}
'''Yonnette Fleming''' is an American urban farmer and community earth steward based in [[Bedford–Stuyvesant, Brooklyn]]. She is also a multi-disciplinary artist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brooklynartscouncil.org/artists/1462|title=Yonnette S Fleming|website=Brooklynartscouncil.org|access-date=2016-08-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180315133332/http://www.brooklynartscouncil.org/artists/1462|archive-date=2018-03-15|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
Yonnette Fleming is an urban food justice educator for the Hattie Carthan Community Garden Farm in the Bedford-Stuyvesant community in [[Brooklyn]], New York. The [[Hattie Carthan]] Farm was started by Hattie Carthan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hattiecarthangarden.com/|title=Hattie Carthan Community Garden|website=Hattiecarthangarden.com|access-date=2016-08-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160802034805/http://www.hattiecarthangarden.com/|archive-date=2016-08-02|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nycgovparks.org/about/history/community-gardens/greatness|title=Tales of Gardening Greatness – Community Gardens : NYC Parks|website=Nycbovparks.org|access-date=2016-08-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160721234252/https://www.nycgovparks.org/about/history/community-gardens/greatness|archive-date=2016-07-21|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> The [[Hattie Carthan]] Community Garden farm is located at Marcy and Lafayette in Brooklyn's Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caes.uga.edu/alumni/news/southscapes/spring11/extension.html|title=Extension - Southscapes Spring 2011 - News - Alumni & Friends at CAES - UGA|author=Cindy Tucker|website=Caes.uga.edu|access-date=2016-08-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908121821/http://www.caes.uga.edu/alumni/news/southscapes/spring11/extension.html|archive-date=2015-09-08|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> Hattie Carthan founded the Magnolia Tree Earth Center, and the Bedford-Stuyvesant Neighborhood Tree Corps in 1971. She is a community based education initiative organizer.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://design2pro.com/ourtimepress/2016/176/files/assets/basic-html/page15.html |title={title} |access-date=2016-11-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161110235448/http://design2pro.com/ourtimepress/2016/176/files/assets/basic-html/page15.html |archive-date=2016-11-10 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> Fleming's approach is holistic and communal. She is a lifelong musician.<ref name="topi.com">{{cite web|url=https://jfc2016.topi.com/speaker/yonnette-fleming-QjmUF|title=Yonnette Fleming|website=Jfc2016.topi.com}}</ref>
One of the missions of the garden is to bridge the gap between generations to collaborate in the sharing of historical knowledge for sustainable living and health. It is a farm urban community where all ages participate in the development, well-being of the gardens, well-being of the community residents of Bedford-Stuyvesant community in Brooklyn. She facilitates and teaches the Bed-Stuyvesant community to reclaim and cultivate well-being. The garden project is a Bedford-Stuyvesant community revitalization project. The urban farm is an educational food justice farm. Food justice is at the core of what Yonnette Fleming does.<ref name="topi.com" />
She is a part of a growing movement of community gardeners and growers and the rise of black farmers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbnomics.com/top-five-black-farmers-black-farming-back-rise/|title=Top Five Black Farmers, Black Farming is back on the rise!|date=6 May 2016|website=Bbnomics.com|access-date=2016-08-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160826010419/https://www.bbnomics.com/top-five-black-farmers-black-farming-back-rise/|archive-date=2016-08-26|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
==Early life== Yonnette was born in [[Guyana]]. Her family worked with indigenous communities and grew coconuts, sugar, rice, and other crops. Fleming has worked since 2003 to address food insecurity in Brooklyn's Bedford-Stuyvesant (or "Bed-Stuy") neighborhood. While working on Wall Street years ago she joined the community garden. She left her wall street job in 2008 in order to invest herself fully into community, food, and community empowerment.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://civileats.com/2015/05/14/how-a-former-wall-street-exec-invested-in-fresh-food-for-her-community/|title=How a Former Wall Street Worker Invested in Fresh Food for Her Community|first=Siena|last=Chrisman|date=14 May 2015|website=Civileats.com|access-date=2016-07-29|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160728145034/http://civileats.com/2015/05/14/how-a-former-wall-street-exec-invested-in-fresh-food-for-her-community/|archive-date=2016-07-28|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> Her grandmother raised chickens in Berbice, Guyana, South America.
==Career== Yonnette Fleming has been doing urban gardening and farming for over 16 years. She is a project catalyst and vice president of the Hattie Carthan Community Garden farm. She is the main coordinator for the Hattie Carthan Herban Farm and two community food markets. She has worked to address [[food security]] and [[food justice]] concerns since 2003.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brooklyndaily.com/stories/2016/4/all-britview-community-gardens-2016-01-22-bd_.html|title=Hey, Mr. Mayor, Brooklyn’s community gardens don’t deserve a date with the wrecking ball|website=Brooklyndaily.com|access-date=2016-08-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160924073308/http://www.brooklyndaily.com/stories/2016/4/all-britview-community-gardens-2016-01-22-bd_.html|archive-date=2016-09-24|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> She teaches local children and various communities in [[New York City]] creative cooking and urban farming at the Hattie Carthan Farm in Brooklyn. She teaches workshops in herbalism and plant medicine. There is also a Hattie Carthan Herban Farm and Apothecary Market. The Herban farm grows and teaches how to use and cook with medicinal herbs. The cooking classes are free. The workshops teach seniors and youth groups. The Hattie Carthan Garden farms have trained youth chefs. She teaches a food justice course for the Farm School in NYC. She is a member of the Farm School's advisory board.<ref name="topi.com"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.farmschoolnyc.org/|title=HOME|website=Farmschoolnyc.org|access-date=2016-07-29|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160816115449/http://www.farmschoolnyc.org/|archive-date=2016-08-16|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
She is a raphaologist, ordained minister, plant and sound medicine practitioner, reiki master, healing circle facilitator, and herbal Wysewoman.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.urbanbusheducator.com/About-Us.html|title=The Urban Bush Educator Project - About Us|website=Urbanbusheducator.com|access-date=2016-08-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160507225343/http://www.urbanbusheducator.com/About-Us.html|archive-date=2016-05-07|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
Fleming is an advocate for community based knowledge systems to build healthy individuals, families, and communities. She works on a local level to address [[food sovereignty]] and food insecurity issues in the Bedford-Stuyvesant community. The focus is on inter-generational education, the needs of the community, an aging population, and youth development. The Hattie Carthan Urban Agriculture Youth Corp employs and educates local teenagers within the Bedford-Stuyvesant community. She is the founder of the Urban Bush Educator Project. It is a multi-dimensional ancient healing arts project created by Yonnette Fleming. A healing learning framework for community support, healing, and community revitalization. She combines her healing training with farming and gardening. She conducts workshops in re-connecting with nature, herbal healing, drum journey meditations, percussion circles, nature art, aura cleansing, etc. She has been conducting healing workshops for over two decades.
Yonnette teaches scent-making and the connection between healing and scents.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/10/garden/10perfume.html|title=Making Flowers Into Perfume|date=10 June 2010|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-02-28|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170223131151/http://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/10/garden/10perfume.html|archive-date=2017-02-23|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> She is a trained Reiki healing master. She considers herself a "social change activist." She is a Just Food community food educator. Just Food is a nonprofit organization in New York City. As a community food educator she gives cooking demonstrations at green markets in New York City.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.restorationplaza.org/about/news/farmersmarketpressrelease|title=Local Farmers’ Markets Kick Off 2016 Season - Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration|website=Restorationplaza.org|access-date=2016-08-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160806075226/http://www.restorationplaza.org/about/news/farmersmarketpressrelease|archive-date=2016-08-06|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>

{{Orphan|date=December 2012}}
[[File:My School.JPG|thumb|alt=Independence Day in TVS Matriculation Higher Secondary School, during which the cause of youth in Indian Politics was strongly stressed with means of a Skit.|Independence Day in [[TVS Matriculation Higher Secondary School|TVSMHSS]], during which the cause of youth in Indian Politics was strongly stressed with means of a Skit.]]
Many initiatives were taken in many schools to develop the interest among students to enter Indian politics. The Field of politics is usually a perception that it is not suited to Educated People<ref name="gupte">Gupte 2004</ref> and this perception is being changed by many school students who take up the idea of politics as their career and help promoting the cause.
== Importance of Youth in Indian politics ==
In 2004, 50% of the Indian population was aged 30 years or younger; however, only 35 out of 543 [[Lok Sabha]] members (6%) were aged under 35.<ref name="gupte"/> Nevertheless, the [[World Values Survey]] showed that the proportion of people aged 18–24 who identified themselves as "very" or "rather" interested in politics was around 50, an increase of 15% since 1990.<ref name="dna">"More Indian Youth Interested in Politics" 2006</ref>
All major political parties have youth and student wings, such as [[Indian Youth Congress]], [[Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad]], and [[Democratic Youth Federation of India]]
A campaign by [https://youngindiafoundation.org Young India Foundation] has been raising awareness on the importance of youth rights and the essential representation they need in a country with over 670 million people below the age of 25. YIF is also leading in the Age of Candidacy campaign which is working on decreasing the age of candidacy in India from 25 to something lower.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ageofcandidacy.in}}</ref>
== Use of Social Media == As per a report by the [[ASSOCHAM | Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (Assocham)]], of the approximately Rs 4,000-5,000 Crore total advertisement and publicity spend in 2014 Indian Parliament elections, the digital platforms can expect to garner at least Rs 400-500 Crore. The target audience are predictably the youth, many of them first-time voters.<ref>{{cite news|last=Dutta|first=Medha|title=Election 2014 is all about social media|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/home/lok-sabha-elections-2014/news/Election-2014-is-all-about-social-media/articleshow/33835014.cms|accessdate=13 May 2014|newspaper=The Times of India|date=17 April 2014}}</ref>
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==References== * {{cite journal |last=Gupte |first=Pranay |title=Where are youth in Indian politics? |journal=[[The Straits Times]] |date=20 May 2004 |url=http://www.pranaygupte.com/article.php?index=76 |accessdate=2010-03-11}} * {{cite web |title=More Indian youth interested in politics |work=DNA |date=16 September 2006 |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report_more-indian-youth-interested-in-politics_1053438 |publisher=Diligent Media Corporation |location=Mumbai |accessdate=2010-03-11}}
[[Category:Politics of India]] [[Category:Youth politics|India]] [[Category:Youth in India|Politics]]
